Through years of manipulation and physical training, Costello turns Sullivan into his obedient proxy in the police department. The dynamic between them, built on loyalty and trust, is both fascinating and terrifying.

Costigan is tasked with going undercover to undermine Costello's operation, while Madden is assigned to treat Costello's psychiatric condition. The two start a relationship that complicates Costigan's mission, as his developing feelings for Madden add a layer of personal stakes to his work.

3. Dignam and Sullivan - The dynamic between Sergeant Dignam and Colin Sullivan is characterized by tension and suspicion. Dignam is the only character who sees through Sullivan's facade and suspects him of being an informant. The two characters clash repeatedly throughout the film, leading up to a pivotal confrontation.

Overall, each character's relationship in the film affects the dynamic of the criminal underworld in one way or another. The interplay between their loyalties, distrust, and personal stakes make the film's themes of deception and betrayal all the more poignant.
